download.name: Download

welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
# SoundCloud Scraper
Scrape data from soundcloud easily.

[![NPM](https://nodei.co/npm/soundcloud-scraper.png?downloads=true&downloadRank=true&stars=true)](https://nodei.co/npm/soundcloud-scraper/)

# Installation

```sh
$ npm i soundcloud-scraper
```

# Documentation
**[https://soundcloud-scraper.js.org](https://soundcloud-scraper.js.org)**

# Example
## Downloading a Song

> Note: This process can take few seconds if you do not provide api key
> because it will first find the api key and then fetch respective track url to get final stream url
> and then download it. To solve this issue, first get your soundcloud key using `SoundCloud.keygen()` and then save it somewhere.
> Later you can pass that key in `SoundCloud.Client` constructor: `new SoundCloud.Client("API_KEY")`.

```js
const SoundCloud = require("soundcloud-scraper");
const client = new SoundCloud.Client();
const fs = require("fs");

client.getSongInfo("https://soundcloud.com/dogesounds/alan-walker-feat-k-391-ignite")
    .then(async song => {
        const stream = await song.downloadProgressive();
        const writer = stream.pipe(fs.createWriteStream(`./${song.title}.mp3`));
        writer.on("finish", () => {
          console.log("Finished writing song!")
          process.exit(1);
        });
    })
    .catch(console.error);
```

params.name: API_KEY
params.description: Existing API key (if any). Else SoundCloud scraper will try to fetch one for you :)

params.name: force
params.description: IF it should forcefully parse version

params.name: options.fetchStreamURL
params.description: If it should fetch stream url

params.name: KEY
params.description: Existing API key (if any). Else SoundCloud scraper will try to fetch one for you :)

methods.name: fetchStreamURL
methods.description: Fetch stream url from soundcloud track url

params.name: trackURL
params.description: Track url to fetch stream from

params.name: data
params.description: Raw data to instantiate this class

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Returns JSON version of the data

props.name: playCount
props.description: Number of times this song was played

props.name: publishedAt
props.description: Timestamp when this song was published

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Returns JSON object of the song

methods.name: parseDuration
methods.description: Parse duration and convert it to ms.

props.name: fetchAPIKey
props.description: If it should fetch api key on startup

props.name: createdAt
props.description: Timestamp when the user was created

props.name: playCount
props.description: Total play count of the song
